author: cnbc.com
title: Yelp beats Street 4Q forecasts
text:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) _ Yelp Inc. (YELP) on Wednesday reported fourth-quarter net income of $142.1 million, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier.
The San Francisco-based company said it had profit of $1.60 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to 19 cents per share.
The results exceeded Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 12 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 5 cents per share.
The online business reviews company posted revenue of $218.2 million in the period, also topping Street forecasts. Fourteen analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $215.1 million.
For the current quarter ending in April, Yelp said it expects revenue in the range of $218 million to $221 million. Analysts surveyed by Zacks had expected revenue of $220 million.
The company expects full-year revenue in the range of $935 million to $965 million.
Yelp shares have risen 7 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $44.91, a climb of almost 8 percent in the last 12 months.
